repository.corpname: University of Washington Libraries Special Collections

origination.corpname: United Association of Journeymen and Apprentices of the Plumbing and Pipe Fitting Industry.$bWashington State Association

did.unittitle: Washington State Association of the U.A. Plumbers and Pipefitters records
did.abstract: Records of the Washington State Association of the U.A. Plumbers and Pipefitters

bioghist.p: Washington State Association of U.A Plumbers and Pipefitters (WSA) was founded in 1921 to promote cooperation of all plumber and pipefitters local unions in the State of Washington so they may protect each local union member from "unjust and injurious competition."

In 1995, the WSA established an organizing department funded by all working members of the WSA to address lost market share and union density, and is one of the earliest statewide organizing systems in the United States. The WSA coordinates and funds organizing activities in area U.A. Plumbers & Pipefitters locals and works to prevent the open shop. The WSA has signed nearly 200 contractors since it started and has organized over 1,000 new members. The WSA is active legislatively and politically, coordinating political action of local unions and their members at both the local and national level.

As of 2013, the WSA had 7,324 members belonging to six local unions, all of which are United Association affiliates. The association's affilates are: UA Local 26- Western Washington Plumbers and Steamfitters; UA Local 32- Seattle Plumbers and Steamfitters; UA Local 44- Spokane Plumbers and Steamfitters; UA Local 598- Pasco Plumbers and Steamfitters; UA Local 669- Road Sprinklerfitters; UA Local 699- Seattle Sprinklerfitters

scopecontent.p: This collection documents the numerous activities of the Washington State Association of U.A. Plumbers and Pipefitters (WSA) and the interactions with its various locals throughout the state of Washington: Local 32 (Seattle), Local 40 (Bellingham), Local 44 (Spokane), Local 82 (Tacoma), Local 175 (Mount Vernon), Local 358 (Aberdeen), Local 549 (Yakima), Local 598 (Kennewick/Pasco), Local 631 (Bremerton) and Local 695 (Longview). The collection spans from 1945-2006. The bulk of the documents from this collection originated from the internal departments of the WSA; some materials were collected from various offshoots of the WSA. The largest series in the collection is WSA Conventions and Resolutions (Series XII), which details the substantial planning and execution of forty-two separate annual conventions from 1946-1992, including the 50th “Golden Anniversary” Convention held in Yakima in 1971. Also of note are the numerous legal cases found in Legal Files (Series IX). There are particularly extensive materials on two National Labor Relations Board Cases: the Harless Case (Local 598 [Pasco] and Harless, et. al. and Washington State Board of Negotiators) and the MacDonald and Scott Associates Case (Plumbers and Steamfitters Locals 598 (Kennewick) and 44 (Spokane) and McDonald-Scott & Associates. Projects and disputes pertaining specifically to union authority can be found in Jurisdictional Documents (Series X). The materials located in Executive Board (Series I) and Washington State Board of Negotiators (Series II) highlight the issues most pertinent to the WSA, as well as the ways in which the issues were resolved. Mergers (Series VII) shows the ways in which the locals were consolidated or absorbed into larger locals throughout the years. Although Board of Trustees (Series III), Business Managers (Series IV), Pension Committee (Series V) and Residential Housing (Series VI) are all smaller series, they offer insight into the disparate subjects that various groups within the WSA have dealt with in the past. The day-to-day workings of the WSA can be evaluated from the Financial Documents (Series VIII) and Office Files (Series XI). WSA Locals (Series XIII) gives a glimpse into the issues most relevent to individual locals of the WSA.

arrangement.p: The accession is arranged into 13 series.

p.emph: Series II: Washington State Board of Negotiators, 1958-1981
Series XII: WSA Conventions and Resolutions, 1941-1992

arrangement.p: Each series is arranged by material format. Within these sub-series, individual files are arranged in either chronological or reverse chronological order, depending on the original order in which the items were found.

p.extref: View selections from this collection in digital format

phystech.p: Records are stored offsite; advance notice required for use.

userestrict.p: Creator's literary rights transferred to the University of Washington Libraries

processinfo.p: Eighteen photographs received with this collection have been relocated to Visual Materials, VM 1216.

otherfindaid.p: The visual materials that form part of this collection are described and indexed in the guide to the .

scopecontent.p: Series I includes extensive meeting minutes for the WSA Executive Board from 1950-1993, as well as a small amount of the Executive Board’s correspondence from the 1960s. There is also a few undated lists of Executive Board Members.

SERIES II: WASHINGTON STATE BOARD OF NEGOTIATORS, 1958-1981

scopecontent.p: Series II includes meeting minutes and correspondence, as well as a handful of contract negotiations. The series also includes a 1954 committee resolution and the minutes from the trial of Board of Negotiators member Grant Wood.

arrangement.p: The series is subdivided by material format: Subseries A: Washington State Board of Negotiators: Meeting Minutes; Subseries B: Washington State Board of Negotiators: Correspondence; Subseries C: Washington State Board of Negotiators: Resolution; Subseries D: Minutes of the Grant Wood Trial.

scopecontent.p: Series III includes a few sets of meeting minutes from the Board of Trustees.

scopecontent.p: Series IV includes the minutes from a 1973 meeting of the Tri-State Business Managers.

scopecontent.p: Series V includes the Pension Committee’s meeting minutes and expenses from 1961-1962. There is also a Pension Plan and Agreement and Declaration of Trust from 1962.

arrangement.p: The series is subdivided by material format: Subseries A: Pension Committee: Meeting Minutes; Pension Committee: Meeting Expenses; Subseries C: Pension Plan and Agreement and Declaration of Trust.

scopecontent.p: Series VI includes minutes, correspondence and contract negotiations of the Residential Housing committee. The bulk of the materials are from the 1970s.

arrangement.p: The series is subdivided by material format: Subseries A: Residential Housing: Meeting Minutes; Subseries B: Residential Housing: Correspondence; Subseries C: Residential Housing: Contract Negotiations.

scopecontent.p: Series VII includes materials relating to various mergers between different locals in the WSA during the 1970s and 1980s.

arrangement.p: The files in this series are arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.p: Series VIII includes complete financial audits of the WSA for the years 1962-1980, as well as two other financial ledgers, one which covers the years 1982-2000.

arrangement.p: The series is subdivided by material format: Subseries A: Audit Reports; Subseries B: Per Capita Payments; Subseries C: General Financial Journal with Closing Materials. The materials in Subseries A: Audit Reports are arranged in reverse chronological order.

scopecontent.p: Series IX includes a large number of legal cases from 1954-1975, the bulk of which are from the late 1950s and early 1960s. Cases deal with disputes over union membership, breaches of contract, hiring procedures and discrimination in the workplace.

arrangement.p: The series is subdivided first by the legal arena in which the cases were settled: Subseries A: National Labor Relations Board Cases; Subseries B: County Court Cases; Subseries C: United States District Court for the Western State of Washington; Subseries D: United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit; Subseries E: Miscellaneous Legal Files. Subseries A: National Labor Relations Board Cases is further subdivided by which WSA local was involved in the case and arranged numerically: Part 1: Local 32 (Seattle); Part 2: Local 40 (Bellingham); Part 3: Local 82 (Tacoma); Part 4: Local 549 (Yakima); Part 5: Local 598 (Kennewick); Part 6: Local 695 (Longview); Part 7: Cases Involving Multiple Locals. Within each part, individual files are arranged chronologically. Subseries B: County Court Cases is further subdivided by county court location and arranged alphabetically: Part 1: Franklin County Court; Part 2: King County Court; Part 3: Pierce County Court; Part 4: Skagit County Court; Part 5: Snohomish County Court. Within each part, individual files are arranged chronologically. Individual files in Subseries C: United States District Court for the Western State of Washington and Subseries E: Miscellaneous Legal Files are arranged chronologically.

unittitle.emph: Subseries A: National Labor Relations Board Cases, 1955-1973

scopecontent.p: Subseries X includes files pertaining to a variety of projects involving jurisdictional issues. Disagreements come to a head in Subseries C: Jurisdictional Disputes.

arrangement.p: The Series is subdivided by material format: Subseries A: Project Files; Subseries B: Jurisdictional Correspondence; Subseries C: Jurisdictional Disputes; Subseries D: Inter Agreements / Letters of Assent. Subseries A: Project Files is further subdivided by material function: Part A: Pre-Job and Mark-Up Meetings; Part B: Project Processes; Part C: Engineering Plans. Within each part, Individual files are arranged chronologically. Subseries B: Jurisdictional Correspondence is arranged chronologically. Subseries C: Jurisdictional Disputes is further subdivided by the arena in which the cases were settled: Part A: Impartial Jurisdictional Disputes Board for the Construction Industry; Part B: National Labor Relations Board. Individual files within each part are arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.p: Series XI contains various files pertaining to the day-to-day workings of the WSA.

arrangement.p: The series is subdivided by material format: Subseries A: Constitutions and By-Laws; Subseries B: Wage Scale for Plumbers and Steamfitters; Subseries C: List of Local Unions, pre-1970; Subseries D: William "Bill" Ford, Journeyman and Apprentice Coordinator's Reports; Subseries E: Plumbers and Pipefitters Council of the Northwest; Subseries F: Letters re: Illness and Death of William J. Linaham; Subseries G: Concrete Cutting/Concrete Coring. Individual files within Subseries A: Constitutions and By-Laws are arranged in reverse chronological order.

SERIES XII: WSA CONVENTIONS AND RESOLUTIONS, 1946-1992

scopecontent.p: Series XII contains extensive minutes, correspondence and other materials pertaining to the annual WSA conventions from 1946-1992, as well as some of the resolutions that evolved out of the conventions during the 1960s-1970s.

arrangement.p: The series is subdivided by material format: Subseries A: WSA Conventions; Subseries B: WSA Resolutions. The individual files within Subseries A: WSA Conventions are arranged in reverse chronological order by the year that the convention was held. The files in Subseries B: WSA Resolutions are arranged in reverse chronological order.

scopecontent.p: Series XII contains meeting minutes created by individual locals within the WSA. These files were obtained by the WSA post-production.

arrangement.p: The series is subdivided by creator: Subseries A: Meeting Minutes of Local 40 (Tacoma) and Subseries B: Meeting Minutes of Local 358 (Aberdeen). Individual files within Subseries A: Records of Local 40 (Tacoma) are arranged in reverse chronological order.
